definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那里他专心一志地做生意，在几年中就赚到许多钱。

sentences.english: Many teachers are waiting for new replacements before retiring.
sentences.chinese: 许多教师正在等候新进人员，以便退休。

sentences.english: Many people still cling to the old customs and beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 许多人仍然固守旧习惯和信仰。

sentences.english: I was baffled that some ofthe most basic workplace blunders seem to be tripping people up!
sentences.chinese: 许多最基本的职场失误会让他们摔跟头，这让我困惑。

sentences.english: There are many cases of human rights violations filed before the police.
sentences.chinese: 警方接手许多人权侵犯案件，往往牵连到高级官员。

sentences.english: As the Speaker said, we've got more to do.
sentences.chinese: 正如佩洛西所说的，我们还有许多事情要做。

sentences.english: Many were asked, but few were able to answer.
sentences.chinese: 许多人被问到，可是很少人答得出来。

sentences.english: Many schools around the country have adopted similar coursework.
sentences.chinese: 全国许多学校创立了相似的课程。

sentences.english: Finance and Administration includes various departments such as …
sentences.chinese: 财务与行政部包括许多不同的部门。

sentences.english: There are a lot of exaggerations and falsehoods about the Indians.
sentences.chinese: 关于印第安人有著许多不实之辞及谎言。

sentences.english: Many southerners said all of the North was responsible for the raid.
sentences.chinese: 许多南方人说，所有的北方人都应该对这次袭击负责。

sentences.english: As you can see, there are some consequences with the current arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 正如您所看到的，当前这种安排还存有许多问题。

sentences.english: Through many dangers, toils, and snares I have already come.
sentences.chinese: 许多危险，试练网罗，我已安然经过。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong many square miles of land have been reclaimed from the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在香港，许多平方英里的陆地都是填海开拓出来的。

sentences.english: However some grownup parents never figure out how to talk to a child.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多家长怎么也学不会正确地和孩子交谈。

sentences.english: A lot of them were persecuted and tortured to death by their political opponents.
sentences.chinese: 许多人被他们的政敌迫害致死。

definition: some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
(used for abstract things) a good deal, a lot of
every kind of/all kinds of/various kinds
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
